He went into the house.
Are you going by train?
Does this train go to Newcastle?
Where did Helena goLet's go for a walk.
I have to go and pick the kids up nowWe went skating yesterday.
We're going camping on FridayWe went shopping in town last SaturdayI'm going to call her tonight.
I'm going to be a dancer when I grow upIt's going to snow tonight.
They're going to have their first baby in JuneIt's going to be a long journey, kids, so if you want to go to the toilet do so nowMy exams went really well.
"How did your interview go?" - "Rather badly!"
Something's gone wrong with my computerSomething's gone wrong with my computerThe food had gone by the time we got to the party.
When I turned round, the man had goneThat top doesn't go with these trousers.
This jacket and skirt don't go together do theyHe went bald in his twentiesThis road goes to BirminghamI can't remember how his latest song goesThe day went very quicklyA cat goes 'Miaow'.
"Your dog's behaving oddly!" - "He goes like that when he wants some food.Did you get the car goingI won't go into detail over the phone, but I've been having a few health problems recently He kissed her on the cheek and she went bright red.It goes without saying that smoking is harmful to your healthProsperity goes hand in hand with investmentDinner is at eight, but I had an apple to keep me goingThe business is going from strength to strengthThere are only two weeks of term to goAfter his wife died, his health started to go downhillI think people go overboard with presents at ChristmasHe went out of his way to make us feel welcomeThese days when we go out, I feel as though he's just going through the motionsHe even went so far as to stop her using the telephone
